intro: Matthiola bolleana subsp. bolleana, commonly known as the Bolleana stock, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of fragrant, four-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of white, pink, and purple. It produces small, round pods that contain several seeds, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. The species is well adapted to dry, sunny conditions and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
